Use these links to direct client's around the fact find.


Profile Main Menu: https://portal.novawm.com/profile


Personal Details: https://portal.novawm.com/profile/personal-details/


Employment: https://portal.novawm.com/profile/employment/


Family Members: https://portal.novawm.com/profile/family-members/


Assets & Investments Menu: https://portal.novawm.com/profile/investments/


Liabilities: https://portal.novawm.com/profile/liabilities/


Spending & Saving: https://portal.novawm.com/profile/spending-and-saving/


Nominated Bank Details: https://portal.novawm.com/profile/bank-details/


Annual Review:

https://portal.novawm.com/profile/review

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
PROFILE INSTRUCTIONS


Updated: 01/12/2020. 


This task generates when a client makes a change to their profile. Only one task of this type will ever be open at a time.


FF Records vs SF Records


  • SF Records are records that contain data that we have verified to be true, either because we entered it ourselves or by validating data that is entered by the client. These are just normal records that you have used previously. Found in the Profile tab.


  • FF Records each time a change is made to an SF record, we make a copy of the new set of data and store it in a corresponding FF record. Every SF object has a corresponding FF object ( Employment vs FF Employment). This then creates a change history, with every SF record having a complete history of every change that has been made, with the most recent record being the one that is up to date. When a client makes a change to their profile, this is also recorded as a new FF record, but we need to validate it before the changes are pushed into the SF record. Found in the Profile Updates tab.




Process Workflow



When a client logs in and opens a record, i.e a pension they added previously, they will see whatever is stored in the most recent FF record whether it has been validated or not. They will not see any records that have been deleted or rejected. 


If there are validations outstanding, internal users will not be able to make any changes to SF records. 


Profile Controls



Here you can see when the client last interacted with the Profile, what type they are on and the current status. 


Feedback


The results of the feedback questions we ask at the end of the profile. If the client has completed the profile several times there may be multiple entries here. 


Object Sections


Under each of these sections, you will see the changes that the client has made.


  • FF Accounts - Changes to any Person Accounts or Household field
  • FF Employment
  • FF Financial Products
  • FF Assets
  • FF Liabilities


Validation Process


Navigate to Household > Profile Updates. You will see that each FF object has a “Validated” Column, if this is blank then the record needs to be validated. 


Click into the FF record, and you’ll see the data stored in it and the Validation Section. 


Validated Options 


  • Validated - Marking a record as Validated will push the changes into the corresponding SF record, or it will create a new SF record if one does not already exist.
  • Rejected - This will reject the changes and the client’s profile will revert back to the most recent validated record. 
  • Confirm Deletion - The client has deleted a record from their portal. If you confirm this deletion it will be removed from SF
  • Overwritten - This option is only ever selected automatically when a client makes multiple changes to the same record. 


Once all outstanding FF records have been either Validated or Rejected you will be able to close of the task off and be able to make changes to SF records as normal.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Profile Status


This status is purely for internal operations visibility, the status will be updated automatically where possible, but otherwise, it’s a manual status that you can use to indicate the status of the profile. No automation will be triggered by changing this status. 


  • Update Required - The profile needs to be updated but the client has not yet been informed of this. This is the default status when a Household is first created and will revert back to this status once they have accepted scope. You can also move it to this stage manually if there is every a requirement for the client to update the profile
  • Sent to Client(s) - Designates that clients are aware that they need to update their profile. For Disco’s this will update automatically once a client it first sent the profile. 
  • Updated by Client (Validations Outstanding) - The client has made changes to their profile but they have not marked it as complete. 
  • Completed by Client (Validations Outstanding) - The client has made changes to their profile and marked it as complete. 
  • Up-to-date - Manually select this stage once we have everything we need. It will remain in the stage until we need a new update or the client spontaneously updates their profile. 


Sending the Profile to the Client


Discovery - This is triggered by pressing the button on the personal account. Pressing the button again will resend a new link


Full Profile - Once scope is signed, the profile will automatically change to the full set of profile questions. Clients should be notified of the additional questions at the same stage of the process as the PreciseFP fact find. Again, this is done manually and there is a new email template for this. At any other time, you can link clients to the fact find using the profile Links. 



Joint vs Individual Profiles


Clients cannot add partners through the profile, so we need to ask the client if they would like to include a partner, and add them to Salesforce before sending. The partner does not need to be given access to the portal, but if they are not added the profile will not include a section for their partner. 


You can also give the Partner access to the profile by pressing the Create & Send Profile button on their Person Account. They will see exactly the same thing as Client 1. 


Nominated Bank Details


The norminated bank details section automatically shows once the first piece of fulfilment for a household has been taken up. The client is then manually sent an email which directs them to complete the details.


These details remain visable thereafter. Any changes made will appear as profile validations.
